data.title: Creating and utilizing virtual models and tours on the website
data.content: The aims of this project were to explore 3D imaging technologies and to demonstrate how 3D content can be used on the web./ This was created as part of a Media Services project with Irina Konovalova at Metropolia University of Applied Sciences./ We studied photogrammetry, LiDAR and TrueDepth technologies. Made virtual tours with Matterport camera and looked alternatives to it. /We made this page using Webpack, Pug, Bootstrap, Scss, Three.js./

data.title: Media Day 2022
data.content: The aim of this project was to create an events page that would include a live video stream, promotional and archive videos, calendar and information about the performers for the Media Day 2022 event./ This was created as part of a Media distribution and data flows course with Irina Konovalova at Metropolia University of Applied Sciences./ We used OBS Studio for video capturing and the Wowza cloud server to broadcast our event live./ Code is written with React, Bootstrap and runs on an Azure cloud Ubuntu server./

data.title: Creative coding
data.content: I have long been interested in creative coding and P5.js, a JavaScript library for creative coding. I took a course of study offered by NYUx, an online learning initiative of New York University to gain a better understanding of the subject./ I learned how to use pictures, video, JSON to visualize data, make animations, manipulate text, make complex and harmonious shapes with lissajous curves, use objects and classes in creative way./ On the Openprocessing page you can find my creative coding projects. In their editor, you can view and manipulate the code yourself to see the changes in real time./

data.title: Environmental idealists
data.content: The goal of this project was to create a React page that uses the backend API and takes into account the best user experience and serves people in some way./ This was created as part of a Media services and user experience course with Vilho Voutilainen at Metropolia University of Applied Sciences./ We learned to make our service more user-friendly by doing user experience research and testing. Also learned to work with backend API./ The page is made using React, Material-UI and uses schoolâ€™s backend API./

data.title: Metropolia info app
data.content: The aim of this project was to create a progressive web app with mobile first design for Metropolia students, where they could look up lunch menus, bus times, etc./ This was created as part of a Web technologies and media platforms course with Vilho Voutilainen at Metropolia University of Applied Sciences./ We learned to work with JSON data from api and files and design a mobile first progressive web app./ The page is made using Webpack, Javascript, Scss./
